characters: AUDREY, DO NOT GO IN THE SHIP
I WARNED YOU ALL NOT TO GO BACK
DARRYL, GET THE HELL OUT OF THERE
NONE OF YOUR TEAM MAY REMAIN ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are moving rapidiy down a narrow, dimly lit tunnel ina silent, bubble-topped shuttle vehicle. There is no driver Seated in the left front seat is MIRANDA DORLAC, an extraordinarily beautiful, athletically-built young woman wearing a yellow flight suit. Patches identify her as a member of the "Volcryn Expedition" from Avalon University To Miranda's right is VLADIMIR D'BRANIN, the expedition leader. A tall, gaunt man in his early forties, D'Branin typing rapidly into a portable computer. Miranda glances behind her where we see AUDREY ZALE, LILL KENT, DARRYL FONTAINE, and OWL KEELOR, all of them wearin Voicryn Expedition flight suits. Audrey is an intense- looking brunette in her late 20's. Lilly is a pudgy 30 ye old brunette, Darryl is a compact, slightly effeminate ma in his late 30's. Owl is a good-looking former jock, who iooks ten years clder than his 27 years. Miranda locks back at D'Branin and smiles, seeing he's st typing into his computer at a furious pace. CLOSE ON THE COMPUTER DISPLAY - The screen shows a projec flight path for a ship called "The Nightflyer", headed fo rendezvous with a something called the Volcryn, represent a blinking yellow symbol. At the bottom of the screen the time and date are displayed: 4:46 A.M. 6/26/2087 Avaion University A bell tone is heard and the shuttle pulls to a rapid sto It turns to the right, then rises upwards. Light begins shining down through the tinted glass bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle can be seen rising up from the tunnel into an enormous hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each of the team members react strongly to the sight that awaits them there. THEIR POV: (THROUGH SHUTTLE WINDOW) - "THE NICGHTFLYER" i a ochre-colored cargo vessel, with three spherical holds muscular, backswept wings that give it the appearance of some kind of prehistoric beast. The ship is beautiful, in the way certain spiders are beautiful. Great clouds of steam issue from it's tail section. Its engines generate a powerful, throbbing noise, as if an al factory were operating deep within its boweis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glass bubble rises with a soft hiss. D'Branin hurried puts his computer into his flight bag and gets out, as do the others. Owl takes a flask from his flight suit and knocks back a quick drink before joining them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle's bubble top closes and the vehicle descends back into the tunnel. The team walk closer to the Nightfi

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: It's beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: If you're into dinosaurs. It looks 60 years old...

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: It's a lot older than that.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: It's an excellent ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if it it was the only one we could afford, right? D'Branin looks at her sharply, but he doesn't deny it. Ow whispers to Audrey: own I'd feel better if we were taking ene of the University's garbage rigs than whatever the hell that is... Miranda is standing too far away for a normal person to h heard him, but she fills in the biank:

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: It's a Celidian 9000... One of the Quark Thrusters series. Owl and Audrey look at her, wondering... ANGLE ON THE NIGHTFLYER - The ship's running lights come revealing contours and textures that give the ship's meta skin an almost reptilian quality. CLOSE ON MIRANDA ~ She regards the ship with respect. They are all startled by a loud HISSING noise, as an airl near the front of the ship slides open, and a boarding ra is lowered to the ground. D'Branin hesitates, looking around as if waiting for some to arrive. He turns to Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: This is where we were to meet Jon and Dr. Scott. He checks his watch and looks in both directions. There i no sign of their approach.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: They may already be on the ship. D'Branin nods. His mind is already on the exnedition, an heads for the boarding ramp, oblivious to the others. Miranda turns back to the team, smiling encouragingly.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Let's go. ANGLE ON D'BRANIN - He mounts the ramp. Miranda follows closely behind, and then the others. THEIR POV - The ramp leads up into the dark oval opening. CLOSE ON THE PORTAL - At the top of the opening, we see a hidden video camera aimed downward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the command console, a large oval-shaped monitor shows a point of view of D'Branin and the others following him up the ramp. The picture zooms in on Mirand face until it fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'Branin and Miranda step ineide. The reat of the crew tentatively follow them through. THEIR POV ~ Like the exterior cf the ship, the interior suggests a fusion between machine and animal. The dimly-l corridor is furnished in a biend of rich~looking fabrics rough-textured, overlapping metal plates. There is a feeling of great age to everything, as if it w an immaculately kept exhibit in a museun. ANGLE ON MIRANDA - Miranda goes to the wall, touching the strangely textured fabric. She looks at her teammates. ANGLE ON AUDREY - She walks over to examine a painting hanging on the wall.  INSERT: THE PAINTING - It suggests Munch's “The Scream", painted by a highly disturbed alien. : Darryl puts a hand on Audrey's shoulder and she jumps.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Sorry. Admiring the art work?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I guess that's what it is. They walk away, not noticing that the figure in the paint moves, ever so slightly, as if it had a life of its own. D'Branin calls out:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Royd... Captain... A soft, androgynous-sounding voice comes over the com system.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: T am here, Dr. D'Branin. Welcome to the Nightfiyer. I apologize for not being able to greet you and your crew in a more personable fashion... Everyone looks around for the source of this voice.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ---but Iam presently occupied ina manner which prevents this. CLOSE ON MIRANDA - She notices something up near the ceil and we follows her gaze. HER POV; A tiny video camera pans in their direction. Miranda looks at D'Branin, nervously glancing at his watc

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Captain, there are two other members of our team who were to meet us here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were the first to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: As we are scheduled to take off in less than an hour, there is a great deal I must attend to. I'li join you in the lounge, after takeoff.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Thank you. He gestures for the team to follow him, down the hall tow the lounge. They look at one another, wondering what they gotten themselves into.°

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE OVAL MONITOR - We see the team approaching t entrance to the lounge. An adjacent monitor shows a view the hangar where we see another bubbled-topped vehicie rising up out of the hangar floor, in the same place our team arrived. Two figures emerge from the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JON WINDERMAN - Good-looking, in his early 20's, is an unsettling mixture of wholesomeness and degeneracy. Standing beside him is DR. ELIZA SCOTT, a very pretty, re haired woman of about 30. She is Jon's personal physician and companion: his "psypsych.” They pick up their flight bags and we move with them, as they begins walking toward the ship. We begin to hear a rhythmic, RUSHING noise, which continu as they approach the ship. CLOSE ON JON - He stares at the ship then turns to Eliza, if unwilling to trust his impressions. CLOSE ON ELIZA ~ She is also studying the Nightfiyer, th she turns to Jon. JON'S POV: ELIZA - We can hear her speak, although she is moving her lips:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Are you getting anything cff of it...? Jon pauses, smiling a strange, fractured smile. He answer her telepathically:

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Nothing... worth mentioning. Eliza looks worried. Jon looks over at the ship again and smiles with more assurance.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Honest. Eliza leoks dubious. She walks ahead of hin, stepping up to the boarding ramp. Jon locks up at the ship for a mome then follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room serves as the main living/dining space for the ship. Wine-colored, oddiy textured fabric lining the wali and alien-styled furniture give this room a strange, medieval quality. One wall leads te the galley. The oppos wall is a giant video monitor which provides a view from camera on the nose of the ship. The team is seated an the oval-shaped table, making pre- flight preparations ANGLE ON D'BRANIN ~- Looking extremely tense, he glances his portable computer, then addresses the team:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the latest transmissions from Avalon, the Volcryn are maintaining the plotted flight path. D'Branin turns to Mixexia, who continues.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: We should reach the rendezvous point in eight days. Then we'll have a ten day window, during which they'll make their appearance. Hopefully. D'Branin looks at the team as if somehow trying to convey his excitement about the expedition to them.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: in spite of all our research, there is no way to anticipate what we will actually encounter when we meet... As he is speaking, the door to the lounge opens silently behind him, revealing Jon and Eliza. D'BRANIN (Continued) «what remains as one of the oldest mysteries of the universe... D'BRANIN'S POV - Everyone in the room, stares in his direction. (in actuality at Jon and Eliza.) D'Branin realizes that the team is not looking at him. He turns around to see Jon and Eliza.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Thank God, they made itt... Everything is falling inte place.. CLOSE ON JON - he scans the people seated around the tabl JON'S POV ~ Time seems to nearly stop, as D'Branin rises, and walks slowly over to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like all of you meet the final two members of our team. We're most fortunate to have Jon Winderman, one of the University's six certified class 10 telepaths... and Doctor Elizabeth Scott, Jon's personal physician and a class three in her own right. Meanwhile, from John's POV we see the team and hear their thoughts; sometimes clearly and sometimes overlapping:

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Oh. he's gorgeous.... But I can't stand the bitch with hin... Shit! He's reading my...

dialogues.speaker: OWL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Certified..? Or did he say, certifiable? The higher the rating, the more unstable they are...

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If you're reading this, Jon... I just want you to know I think you're a wonderful human being...

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If we miscalculate plus or minus one half of a percentage with the Volcryn flight path, we should still be within... Why is everyone so ...? When Jon reaches Miranda's face, there is absolute silenc CLOSE ON JON: ~ He starts to look away, but comes back ag as if something was wrong. CLOSE ON MIRANDA - She looks at directly at Jon, her expression perfectly blank. HER POV; CLOSE ON JON - He continues to stare at Miranda 4f extremely puzzied.  HIS POV: CLOSE ON MIRANDA - She smiles ever so slightly. Although she doesn't move her lips, we can hear her whisp

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Just a littie trick I learned... CLOSE ON JON - He smiles at her, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I have a few of my own you might like. CLOSE ON ELIZA —- She watches and listens in-on this "conversation" between Jon and Miranda. BACK TO SCENE - Jon turns around as D'Branin finally reaches him, extending his hand at normal speed.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Jon... Eliza... Please sit down. Improptu greetings are exchanged around the room, as Eliz and Jon take their seats. Royd's soft voice can be heard over the com system:

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Prepare for takeoff. The room lights dim slightly. While D'Branin continues hi his orientation speech to Jon and Eliza.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: We've been approaching the task of establishing communication from every possible avenue. CLOSE ON THE WALL SCREEN ~ It offers a view of the hangar the door begin to slide open. 10  wer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large oval monitor shows the jlounge where D'Branin can be seen speaking to Jon and Eliza: A silver-gloved hand picks up an intricately carved lightpen, aiming it an icon on the control panel representing a fusion generator. As the pen flashes, the icon glows a golden color. A faint rumble is heard from somewhere deep within the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chairs around the oval table automatically lower into horizontal positions as D'Branin finishes his speech:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: In the end, your talents may prove to be successful where our machines fail.: Only time will tell... The team glance at one another, reacting to the oddness o taking off into deep space, in a strange ship, with a captain they have yet to see in person. CLOSE ON THE WALL-SIZED MONITOR ~ It shows a spectacular view of space through the now-open hangar doors. Smoothly, almost silently, the ship passes through the hangar, ewiftly building up speed as it leaves Avalon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Nightfiyer recedes into the darkness of space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the Nightflyer's engines reaches a high-pitc whine and a strong vibration passes through the ship. 41  CLOSE ON THE WALL MONITOR - The view from space changes dramatically as we approach the speed of light: our field vision blurs, flattening out into a lustrous, deep blue radiance. BACK TO SCENE - The chairs rise into upright positions an the team unstrap themselves. Now that they've actually taken off, D'Branin relaxes a little. Ee looks around at ship like a little kid who's gotten control of a toy stor

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The Nightflyer has locked into star @rive. You're all free to move about the ship. Miranda quietly asks Lilly:

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: How long before we can switch to on- board tracking?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: As soon as we drop out of drive.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: And the transmitter?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: We should be able to test it out by tomorrow afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Excellent. He turns to Audrey who's nervously chewing on her fingernaiis in anticipation of his question.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: And what is the projection for decoding the Voleryn disc. 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “@ I've run it through every known _ . decryption algorythm. There's just no internal logic to the signais... Look, Viadimir, I got the disk less than a month ago. You can't expect miracles, D'Branin is silent for a moment. Then he addresses Audrey Slowly, carefully and with a distinct edge to his voice:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I don't expect miracies. But I expect that by the time, we drop out of drive, you will have achieved some kind of breakthrough that will enable us to begin to understand and communicate with these creatures when we meet them.
Audrey is silent, obviously not sharing his optimism. She . @ exchanges glances with Lilly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're working on a self-modifying transmission pattern... as a backup.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I see. Perhaps you ought to turn the @isc over to Jon... as a backup.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: That's not fair, Vladimir! I'm doing everything I...

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I don't think it's a good idea. Everyone turns to Jon, including Eliza who glares at hin, speaking telepathically:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you...? 13  e Jon ignores her, addressing D'Branin: Mee JON I don't want anything that could confuse the signals I'm picking up.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: What signals? Eliza speaks calmly, attempting to dilute the anxiety:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: He's a universal conductor. You have no idea how much cosmic garbage comes through hin. (smiling at Miranda) Anything of significance will develop into a pattern. ot

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: It has...
Everyone turns to him again.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I just can't put it into words yet. Eliza hides her distress, speaking to Jon telepathically:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: The Voleryn?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I don't think so... Just then, an intense beam of red light shines down from ceiling. ROYD ERRIS, the captain of the Nightflyer materializes in the chair opposite D'Branin, in the form @ a shimmering, holographic projection. 14 The holograph is a handsome, pale-eyed young man with sh copper-colored hair. He wears grey, metal- flaked clothes that wrap loosely around his body.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S BOLO
dialogues.text: I apologize for my tardiness but it was unavoidable. ANGLE ON OWL AND AUDREY - He whispers to her:

dialogues.speaker: . OWL
dialogues.text: Is this some Kind of joke?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Shhhhhh. Miranda and D'Branin exchange glances. D'Branin is as perplexed as the others, but he tries to appear nonchalan D'Branin glances up at the ceiling where the holographic Projector is hidden, and then back at the ghostly figure sitting opposite hin.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Ah... How shall I phrase this..?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: You're curious about my present form... D'Branin nods his head. CLOSE ON ROYD'S HOLOGRAPH ~ A smile forms on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: I find that on the Nightfiyer, there is always a great deal of work to be done, and only a finite amount of time in which to do it. By sending out my holograph, Iam, ina manner of speaking, able to be in two places at once... No disrespect is intended. is  The team exchange glances in reaction to this. D'Branin however, acts as if he's satisfied with Royd's explanatio

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: None taken... I'd like to introduce you to my team... ANGLE ON OWL - He whispers to Lilly:

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: This is the wierdest fucking thing I've ever seen...

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: (whispering to Audrey) Look at him. It's like he's looking right through you. oe

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What do you expect from a holograph, eye contact? ” @ CLOSE ON THE HOLOGRAPH - His unseeing eyes seem focus Miranda. D'Branin turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Royd Erris, this is...

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Forgive me for interrupting, but I have aterrible memory for names. Miranda smiles. Apparently she is the only one who finds this amusing. .

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: There will be more than enough time, for all of us to become acquainted... e He seems distracted by something across the table. 16 ANGLE ON JON AND ELIZA ~ Eliza sees that Jon is staring into space, with a pained look in his eyes. She takes his hand, whispering telepathically. .

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What are you feeling? A fine sweat breaks out on Jon's face.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Talk to me, dammit! CLOSE ON JON - The veins on his neck swell and throb visibly. We hear the rushing sound which we heard earlier when he first saw the ship. He speaks aloud:

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Pressure. Everyone in the room turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: QUIET! Please.... CLOSE ON JON - He holds his head as the pressure increase The RUSHING sound grows progressively louder. CLOSE ON MIRANDA - She looks from Jon to Royd's holograph HER POV: A look of concern comes into the holograph's fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conference table is featured in the master console. The camera zooms in until Jon's face fills the screen. He ljooks terrified. The silver gloved hand quickly picks up the lightpen, flashing it at the oval monitor. The screen goes black. i7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JON - A shudder passes through his body, then he relaxes. .

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: It's gone. The other members of the project stare at him. And then a Royd's holograph, which has remained in his chair seat at the head of the table, throughout this incident. Eliza looks closely into Jon's eyes, speaking aloud:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Are you okay? CLOSE ON JON ~ He nods his head, but telepathically we he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... I'm not! CLOSE ON ELIZA ~- She covers her concern, asking aloud:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Can you talk about what you felt? Jon is having trouble maintaining his self-composure. He answers telepathically.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No! Please get me out of here! The crew look at one another uneasily. Eliza smiles, addressing them in a calm, deliberate manner.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be concerned about. I'm afraid Jon is a little oversensitive from his last expedition and he needs some time to adjust to the ship. I'm going to take him back to our cabin, to rest. 18  Ah She starts to help Jon to his feet, but he manages on his own. The door opens and they leave. The team members glan uncemfortably at one another and then at the holograph, still seated at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: I'm sure you all have work to attend to, as I do, so I will bid you goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Very well, Captain. Goodnight. The holograph disappears. D'’Branin pauses a moment, and acting as if nothing unusual had happened, glances at his flight intinerary. He resumes where he left off earlier:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: As soon as we drop cut of drive, we're going to need a complete spectral analysis of the entire targeted area which the Volcryn are due to pass through. Owl... Owl looks from D'Branin up to the recessed holographic projector in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: Complete spectral analysis... No problen. The rest of the team look questioningly at each other and then at D'Branin,.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliza opens the door and helps Jon over to his bed. He li down, and she sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Can't you control yourself? 19 We hear the RUSHING sound, which grows louder as we move closer to Jon. He turns back to stare up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: You can't do this to me again! HIS POV ~ For a brief flash, the wall covering of the roo seems to burn away, revealing a network of veins carrying pulsing, vermilion-colored liquid throughout the ship.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jon... BACK TO SCENE ~ Eliza sees that he's gone into a trance. checks his eyes, breathing, and pulse. Opening up her medical kit, she take out a hypodermic gun and loads ina vial containing a purple liquid. Eliza places the gun against Jon's neck and pulls the trigger. He begins to re almost immediately. Eliza watches him a moment, then sits down beside him, stroking his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the same image on the oval monitor cf Royd's conso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey and Lilly are unpacking the last of the computer and communication equipment, setting it up against the false wall of the bay. They pause to catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: We're stuck here in a cargo bay, on a ship captained by a holographic projection, flying with an unstable telepath, on a mission to establish communication with the most alien life form in the universe... 20

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eo It's perfect. She starts running some tests on the tracking system whil Audrey enters commands via a keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: The ship doesn't seem to have any crew, except for Royd, right?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: We'd have no way of knowing... but for the sake of argument...

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: os Why not complete automation?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: No reason I can think of.

dialogues.speaker: . AUDREY
dialogues.text: @ I bet Royd Erris doesn't even exist... I bet that holograph is just a a sophisticated artificial intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: It'd have to awfully sophisticated, df it's just a program

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: We'll find out, one way or the other. .

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Don't you think there's something else you should find out, first?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What? @ Lilly switches on a small disc player and we hear a ser of arythmic, wave-like sounds. Audrey shuts the disc. 24

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I've already memorized it. I go to sleep with it... I dream about the Volcryn disc... It's become the single most irritating sound in my entire life.

dialogues.speaker: LIGLY
dialogues.text: Maybe you should let Jon listen to it.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: No way! Besides he said it would confuse him... I'll figure the damn thing out myself... Although I wouldn't mind working with hin. Lilly makes an adjustment on the transmitter and it begin emitting a high-pitched squelch.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Nothing. She puts on a pair of headphones and sets to work once ag on the dreaded Volcryn disc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE OVAL MONITOR - We move back to reveal this scene being watched on the large screen. The other screen show the rest of the team in their separate quarters. The silver-gloved hand flashes the lightpen, changing the image on the oval monitor to D'Branin'’s cabin. ON THE OVAL MONITOR - D'Branin is seated at his desk spea into a microphone attached to his portable computer. The visuals on the screen range from cave drawings to compute generated images. 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Jesus of Nazareth hung dying on -@ his cress, the Volcryn passed within a@ light~year of his agony, headed outward. The image switches to Cargo bay #2, where Owl is working a small hydrepenic garden. Behind him, a makeshift biological laboratory complete with some sort of robotic, surgical/scanner device has already been set up. D'Branin's narration continues ;

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: When the fire wars raged on Earth, the Volcryn sailed near Old Poseidon, where the seas were still unnamed and unfinished. The image changes to the small private cabin where we see Eliza attaching some sort of monitoring device to Jon's forehead, while he lies asleep. a @ D'BRANIN (0.S.) When Kleronomas the Great tock his survey ship out in search of new treasures, he came within ten light years of the Volcryn. Kleronomas found many things, but he did not find the Voleryn... The image switches to Darryl in the galley, loading the team's supplies into their respective places.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: When I was a childof three, Kleronomas the Great was dust, as distant and dead as Jesus of Nazareth, the Volcryn passed close to Daronne. The image changes to a corridor where Miranda is walking to Jon and Eliza's cabin. The door opens and Eliza stands e protectively blocking the entranceway. 23 Miranda asks something about Jon, which Eliza answers wi sone irritation. But then she says something else which makes Eliza laugh and she looks less threatened by Mirand The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MIRANDA - As she walks away, she senses the came up on the wall silently panning to follow her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda's image grows on the oval screen as she approache We sense Royd's growing fascination with this beautiful woman, It becomes even more apparent as the lightpen flashes, freezing her in space, before returning to D'Branin's cabin, as he completes his report on the Voler

dialogues.speaker: . D'BRANIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: When I was grown, the Volcryn sailed beyond the galaxy of Tara, past the range of even the Crey, still heading outward.... He stares at a color picture up on his wall of a beautifu spiral nebulae. We move in until it fills the screen. DISSOLVE To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship is a blur of light as it streams through space a stardrive speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank of monitors show show the rose-colored lights of artificial dawn begin to come up slowly around the ship. 24  We see all the team members are still asleep, except for Miranda who is beginning a workout on a compact, anti~ gravity gym. : The silver-gloved hand flashes the lightpen, and we cut t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is beginning a gymnastic routine when the shimmer form of Royd's holographic spectre appears before her. Miranda pauses briefly, holding her body aloft.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Your stamina is quite impressive.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: (laughs) Compared to what?

dialogues.speaker: . ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Others, I've watched. Miranda looks closely at the holograph, then resumes her routine.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: My parents were geneticists. I guess you could say I was their private research project. They were trying to create an improved model. Miranda dismounts with a flourish, landing inches from th specter. She picks up a towel.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Obviously the experiment was successful.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Sometimes, I have my doubts. But I'd much rather hear your life story, Royd. 25  wt

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: One as improved as you, should be able to guess...

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: {laughs) Allright, Royd. I'm in no hurry. I love mysteries... She walks right through the holograph's shimmering form a out the door. The holograph remains in the empty room for moment as if stunned, then disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A RECESSED VIDEO CAMERA - We follow the camera tilting downward te see Darryl loading the last of the dishes from breakfast into the robotic dishwasher. It clo itself, then switches itself on. He opens the refrigerator and removes a large rectangular block of grey, gelatinous synthetic protein, then rinses in the anti-gravity sink. Humming to himself while he wor Darryi sets the protein block on the counter, and pats it ary with a towel. Darryl] rummages through the drawers and cupboards lookin through the collection of exotic appliances (which belong the ship,) until he comes upon a trianguiar-shaped machin whose appearance suggests an alien Cuisinart. Darryl sets the machine on the counter. As he does, it ma a soft-whirring noise as the top dilates, like the iris o camera. DARRYL ‘ Cute. He peers into the bowl, to see how the device cuts. DARRYL'S POV - looking down into the transluscent, trianguiar bowl. The blade is missing. 26 He looks back in the cupboard and finds a gleaming, doub sided cutting tool, which obviously belongs to it. Humming again, Darryl picks up the tool and reaches into the bowl, attempting to insert it into the motor mount. W hear a click, as the blade leeks into place. Darryl starts to pull his hand out, when we hear the soft whirring noise as the iris/top closes around his forearn. Looking a bit scared, he tries pulling his arm out, but i Clearly stuck. Then we hear a high-pitched whining noise. CLOSE ON DARRYL - He looks down at the transluscent, triangular bowl and screams as it turns bright red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A ROBOTIC ARM - It is using a cutting tool, methodically slicing open the tops on a row of sealed cardboard boxes. We move back to reveal Owl typing into a computer termina which directs the operations of this surgical/scanner machine to which the arm is connected. ANGLE ON THE TABLE - After the boxes are sliced open, Owl removes the contents: bottles of chemicals, beakers and measuring devices, and other supplies, which he places on shelves in the lab. Owl reaches for the flask from his flight suit but finds empty. He returns to the workbench and picks up a box mar DANGER: RADIOACTIVE MATERIALS. He gingerly reaches into it, revealing it to be filled wi bottles of 100% grain alcohol. Owl opens one of bottles, and pours the contents into a coffee cup he is about to drink when the door to the bay suddenly slides open. Darryl walks slowly over to him, looking white as a ghost bloody dish towel is wrapped around his right hand. 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's happened?

dialogues.speaker: . DARRYL
dialogues.text: Let's just say, I'm an idiot... He moves closer to Owl, starting to hand something to hin when he nearly falls. Owl grabs him just as he loses consciousness. He lifts Darryl up onto the table of the surgical/scanner machine. Then he notices the small plast bag clutched tightly in his left hand. Owl extracts the bag and we see that it contains the tips three of Darryl's fingers. Blianching, Owl applies a tourniquet to Darryl's wrist, t quickly sterilizes the hand and the severed fingers. Owl clamps the hand to the table, moving the scanner head so that it is directly over it. He goes to the computer terminal, typing in a command. CLOSE ON THE SCREEN ~ We see a detailed x-ray of Darryl's hand. The image changes to a highly magnified view of the end of one finger, showing the nerve endings. Owl types in a series of commands which activate a roboti hand connected to the surgical/scanner machine. CLOSE OF THE ROBOTIC HAND - It picks up one of the severed finger tips and lines it up with its former finge CLOSE ON THE SCREEN ~- We see the nerve endings moving un they are perfectly lined up. ANGLE ON THE SURGICAL/SCANNER HEAD - A thin, red laser be cauterizes the wound. ANGLE ON OWL - He types in a command and a second robotic hand applies a healing solution, then bandages the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl emerges from the galley, with a large bandage arou his right hand, holding a tray with pizza and assorted drinks. He sets it down on the oval-shaped table where th team have assembled.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Allright, anyone who makes a wise crack does the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Anyone who's stupid enough to stick his hand into a alien food processor, deserves a wise crack.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Hey, I have an active and inquiring mind. I can't help myself.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: That's not the only thing he's got that's active and inquiring. He's lucky he cooks with his hands... The door opens and Owl enters, walking towards the table.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: My savior. Here, I set a special place for you. Darryl ushers Owl over to one of the chairs, where he's s aplace witha cloth napkin, real silverware, and a wine glass. Owl laughs, sitting down.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: If you need anything that's not on the menu, just let me know.

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: Give me a break, will you. 29 He takes a piece of pizza, and notices Royd's vacant sea the head of the table. Owl glances up at the recessed holographic projector in the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: Anybody seen the phantom today?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Royd? He hasn't made an appearance since breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: You notice his clothes? They must be 10 years out of style.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: He makes me nervous... And I don't think I'm the only one that feels that way... D'Branin stops eating and turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Could you be more specific? Lilly seems self-conscious at being put on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: It's hard to explain. I guess I'd feel a lot better if I could see Royd in person... that's all.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: I'd like to know something about his personal background. D'Branin snaps at them with surprising vehemence.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Have any of you been inconvenienced by Royd's desire for privacy? (mo one answers) The port officials at Avalon had no data on personal background. 30 Owl nods cynically, glancing up at the recessed projecto the ceiling. .

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: No, data, huh... He reaches for another slice of pizza and eats it as he walks back toward the rear of the lounge. ANGLE ON D'BRANIN - He works to control his temper. OwL I'll bet you Royd doesn't look anything like that projection.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Why? own He's probably sick or so deformed he's ashamed to show his true forn.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: For all we know he could be some kind of radioactive mutant... > ANGLE ON MIRANDA - She smiles, amused by the speculation.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Don't stop. It's just getting good.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Miranda, it's possible. Own He could have the Slow Plague. It takes decades to kill... And then there's New Leprosy and Langamen’'s disease! Royd's probably in some kind of self-imposed quarantine. ‘ ANGLE ON D'BRANIN - disgusted, he leaves the lounge. 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Langamen's disease?

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: Oh, that's when little greenish- orangy spiny cysts form all over your body and gradually turn into a crispy, reddish-brown crust, like... Like this! (holding up his pizza to his cheek) This is exactly what Langamen's disease looks like... Before it really takes hold.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Do you mind? I'm trying to eat! Owl jJaughs and takes another bite. He turns away from th examining the rear wall of the lounge. On the opposite wall, a hidden camera zooms in on hin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Owl on the large video monitor. He runs his hand along the wall, testing it for soundness. Behind him, we Jon and Eliza enter the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon has a bright, almost feverish look to his eyes, but otherwise seems to be back to normal. He and Eliza sit at the table as Darryl emerges from the galley with a fresh pizza.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Jon! You're back with the living. You had us a little worried yesterday... He sets the pizza on the table, then sits joining then. Audrey comes over and sits next on the other side of Jon. 32

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like you're feeling better. Eliza looks at her, picking up on her interest in Jon.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: “en Were you... able to get any closer to what was bothering you?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I think Eliza was right... It's just getting acclimated to the energy on the ship. (He tastes a piece of pizza) Mmmmmmm. Delicious.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Glad you like it. It's not easy to toss a pizza with one hand.... He pantomimes tossing it. CLOSE ON JON - He stares at Darryl's bandaged hand for a moment, and we hear faint RUSHING sounds, as if Jon were picking up psychic signals from it. Darryl walks away and Jon glances at Miranda, who's watch Owl checking out the rear wall of the lounge. Owl walks b toward them with an odd look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong, Owl? owL I guess it depends on what side of the wall you're on... He sits back down at the table.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Would you care to elaborate on that... or were you just being existential? 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no doors to Royd's cabin, I've already checked the hall. He's sealed in there. The room becomes silent as everyone looks in the directio the rear wall of the lounge. Jon claps his hands, startling them. Eliza looks panicked, but before she can stop him, Jon is already up on his feet, beaming with delight.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? He's sealed in there? That's great! Forget Langamen's disease... That opens up a whole other set of possibilities. owL Pardon..

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You were wondering about Royd... Why limit yourselves to diseases or deformities? He could be real monster! Like a gas giant from Io! Crack open the forward buikhead and watch that methane and ammonia come smoking out! Everyone stares at him, not knowing what to think. Only Miranda seems amused.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: He's kidding. She looks like she's like to strangle Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I'm deadly serious. Royd could be anything in the world... Don't any of you love a mystery? 34 He looks out in the room. For a moment, his and Miranda' eyes meet and we see the sparkle between them. Audrey see it and we sense her jealousy. Eliza also sees it, but we an understanding and no sign of resentment.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Here we all are on an expedition to intercept an alien starship from the core of the galaxy... and you're upset because you can't count the warts on Royd's nose? Owl, Darryl, Eliza and Lilly look at one another, as if asking themseives if perhaps they've been overacting. Jon comes back to the table and picks up a piece of pizza He bites into it and walks toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Then again... he may not have a nose. Laughing to himself, he walks out of the lounge. Eliza rises quickly, following him out. After an brief pause, the rest of the team, rise and begi filing out of the lounge. ANGLE ON MIRANDA - amused by what has just transpired, sh takes a sip of coffee and turns to look at the wali-sized screen. BER POV - We see the view of space from the cameraonthe | nose of the ship. The luminous, deep blue radiance fills screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is sitting cross-legged on the floor, studying a holographic chessboard. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rook to queen's pawn. The piece moves by itself to the sixth rank. Miranda glances up at Royd's holographic specter which is "seated" opposite her. His sigh is heard through the communicator on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: I resign. That makes eight losses in arow. Am I really worth playing?

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Of course you are.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: I should tie in my computer, you'd never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T'd know within three moves. Try it. Miranda gets up and walks directly through Royd's project on her way to the kitchen. Royd's holograph looks disturbed as it stands watching he get a beer from the mini-refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S BOLO
dialogues.text: I wish you wouldn't do that. Miranda walks through him again, feigning innecence. She takes a large sip before turning back to him.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Do what, Royd?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: You ability to play chess is only exceeded by your ability to tease. Was that built in along with your other genetic improvements? 36

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: (laughs) Actually, I had to develop that on my own. Along with a few other abilities... When are you going to break down and let me visit you in person, Captain? She ignores the holograph, speaking directly towards the video camera, mounted on the wall above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE OVAL MONITOR - We see Miranda looking direct at us, with the holograph standing behind her, like an injured lover.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Don't you get lonely in there? Claustrophobic? Sexually frustrated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda continues to ignore the holograph behind her. ROYD'S HOLO ; I've flown the Nightflyer all my life, Miranda. If I were subject to claustrophobia, sexual frustration or loneliness, such a life would have been impossible.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: It won't be long, Royd... and I'll know why. She turns around and the holograph disappears into thin a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon is sleeping uneasily in his bunk. We move in’ close o his face. The RUSHING sound we heard earlier becomes progressively louder until it becomes an EXPLOSION. Jon awakens suddenly. Catching his breath, he looks over at Eliza sleeping in the adjacent bed. He moves to wake her then changes his mind and quietly leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large color transparencies of cave paintings, radio telescopic images, and artistic renderings of the Volcryn are clipped to an illuminated walls. There is an overabundance of research material piled everywhere. D'Branin takes a sip of coffee as he re-reads one of the legends on his computer. He presses the illuminated panel the wall. D‘BRANIN Royd..? Royd's voice comes over the com system:

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Yes, Dr. D'Branin.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: According to our schedule, we still have a little over 72 hours before we actually drop out. D'Branin is startled by Royd's holograph materializing beside him.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Correct, 72 hours and 26 minutes... Forgive me if I startled you...

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Not at all. I just wasn't expecting a... personal visit. 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He studies the holograph, glancing at it's hidden source the ceiling. Then he looks at one of the Voleryn illustrations, taking a deep sip from his mug.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Iam so close now. After twelve years, it seems hard to believe.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: The consummation, of so much work... I can imagine your excitement.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Think of it Royd... A race of sentients sailing out from some unknown origin in the core of the galaxy, bound for intergallactic space... always keeping to the interstellar depths, no planetfalis, seldom coming within a lightyear of a star... If only we can communicate with them... To know the why of then. The holograph smiles. D'Branin locks over at it, beginnin to think of it as a friend.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Boctor, I've wanted to thank you... for respecting my privacy.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Don't mention it, Royd... It's certainly one thing we're all..: There is a pounding on the door. The holograph disappears

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Come in. Jon enters and closes the door quickly. He looks as ill a we've seen him since he's boarded the ship. 3s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to turn back. Immediately. D'Branin tries not to lose his temper.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's not possible. What's the problem? Are you picking up the Volcryn? Jon shakes his head. He speaks to D'Branin telepathically

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No. This is close. On the ship. Something volatile... dangerous. I haven't been able to get to the source yet... CLOSE ON D'BRANIN - He is startled to hear Jon's words inside his own skull. He starts to say something.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Don't speak aloud! This is too much for D'’Branin and he raises his voice:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Have you've talked to Eliza about this?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No. I feit I should see you right away.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I appreciate that, but there's nothing I can do unless you have something concrete.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: This is reai! D'Branin gets up and walks him to the door. 40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to Eliza. I'm sure she can help you. Jon leaves, looking even more disturbed than before. D'Branin returns to his desk. He =ttempts to return to wo but is unable to throw off an uneasy feeling. He presses com button again.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Royd... There is no response. He closes his computer and leaves t cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliza is asleep in bed when there is a knock on the door. She wakes up, and is disturbed at seeing Jon's bed empty. CLOSE ON ELIZA - She closes her eyes and we DISSOLVE TO: HER MIND'S EYE POV - Jon can be seen walking down the din iit corridor of the ship, heading towards Cargo Bay #3. BACK TO SCENE - We hear the knock again. Eliza opens the door, revealing D'Branin standing in the hallway. He peer around her and sees that she's alone.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: ZI was looking for Jon...

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Can I can help you with something? D'Branin enters and the door closes behind him.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: He came to see me earlier... about a threat of some sort. 41  ey

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: I see. Did he tell you anything specific?

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: No... but he seemed extremely disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Class ten's are all unstable in one way or another. It's the price you pay for that kind of sensitivity. I'll have to give him more Psionine.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Psionine?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: A powerful psychic damper. His receptivity will be severly curtailed for several days..

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Several days!? We need him! We'll be dropping out of drive...

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Do you want to lose him for the rest of the flight? It's becoming progressively more difficult for D'Branin t control his temper.”

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Have you come to any conclusions yet about what he's been picking up?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: His mind is in such a state of chaos, it's impossible to evaluate what's coming in.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be an empath! 42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am an empath! If you don't trust. me, you shouldn't have hired me.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I apologize... We're so close now... and there is so much at stake... I'm... Are you absolutely sure he has to remain dampened?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: The only other option would be to give him an injection of esperon. It would triple his psionic receptivity for a few hours. Open him up completely.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: And we'd find out if it this thing is real or not?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: (She nods) But, I don't think he's stable enough to deal with that kind of power. Psionine is safer. If his paranoia persists, we'll know it has nothing to do with his telepathy.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: And if it doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Then we'll know there's a real threat. D'Branin stares at her oddly for a moment. Eliza laughs, having read his mind.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: In answer to your question... No, I'm not a complete fraud. D'Branin smiles, somewhat reassured. 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please keep me informed. The door opens and he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON OVAL MONITOR - We see Jon walking down the corri which leads to Cargo Bay #3 and Miranda's cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon looks weak and physically unstable as he approaches t entrance to the bay. A recessed camera up near the ceilin pans in his direction. Jon stares at it. We begin to hear the rhythmic, RUSHING sounds, which grow louder as Jon approaches the camera. He begins to sweat visibly and leans back against the wall for support. The RUSHING sounds come progressively faster until they are constant. CLOSE ON JON - He holds his ears, falling to the floor. JON'S POV - The fabric covering the walls seems to burn away, revealing the network of glowing red "veins" which pulse throughout the entire ship. The RUSHING sound grows louder and louder as we move in closer to the veins, following them into the wali. We see that all the veins run into an enormous, intricate faceted, ruby-colored stone which glows with its own fier inner light. We move in on this stone until it fills the screen. From 0.S. we hear Jon scream. BACK TO SCENE ~ Miranda emerges from the bay to see Jon o the floor, clutching his head. She rushes over and kneels beside him. CLOSE ON JON - He looks up at her as if his mind were a great distance away.  CLOSE ON MIRANDA ~ She takes Jon's hand, speaking to him telepathically:

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Talk to me Jon... What is it? Behind them, D'Branin and Eliza appear from the opposite of the corridor. She yelis to Miranda:

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Don't touch him! Eliza and D'Branin get to Jon at just about the same time the rest of the team arrive. Jon speaks aloud:

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: An alien mind... She kneels down beside him, trying to get through to him telepathically.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I feel it too, Jon... Don't resist it! Let it come through you! Jon suddenly gets to his feet, trying to run.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Jon! (To the others) Stop him! Owl and Darryl grab Jon, wrestling him to the ground. CLOSE ON JON - He is on the verge ‘of psychosis now. Eliza takes her injection gun from her medical bag but as she approaches Jon, he whips his head from side to side, smashing it into one of the ship's metal support struts. passes cut as blood begins pouring everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Quick! Help me get him into the medical bay! 4s  Owl lifts him onto his shoulder and carries him down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE SURGICAL SCANMER MACHINE ~ It gleams softly the room's dim light. . OwL Clear the table off! Audrey and Lilly do as they're told and Jon is Jaid down the table. Meanwhile, Eliza, and Miranda work quickly, Cleaning, and suturing the wound.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: Let's get the scanner on hin. Darryl and D'Branin attach arm and leg restraints to Jon. The others observe as Owl nervously types a series of commands into the computer which controls the scanner. CLOSE ON OWL - He can't seem to get the machine to do wha he wants it to do. Sweating, he reaches for his “coffee" cup, and a takes a drink. Setting it back down beside the terminal, he types another command and watches the screen CLOSE ON THE SCREEN - It lights up with a drawing that show's Jon form, lying on the table. His brain and vital internal organs are highlighted.

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: Alright.. > Owl type in another command and the scanner head jerks to life then starting at Jon's feet, begins moving swiftly u his body toward his head. Owl begins to relax. He takes another sip from his cup and sets it back down. CLOSE ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN - The scanner head passes ov each organ, revealing all vital signs: respiration, heart beat and brain waves all appear to be normal. 46

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no fracture... I don't see i _anything metabolically wrong with him. Jon starts to regain consciousness. Eliza comes over to h i ELIZA How are you feeling? Jon looks up as a hidden camera, high up on the wall, pan in his direction. He watches it with the same wide-eyed expression as before.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: We're being watched.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: The symptoms seem to be persisting. Eliza takes the injection gun from her medical bag and fi it with psionine.

dialogues.speaker: " D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: ' Why don't you try the Esperon... as you suggested. Eliza hesitates, evidently not wanting to do it.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Couldn't Esperon boost his signais to a-point where he could focus on the threat?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: I aware of the characteristics of...

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: Absolutely! Give him some Esperon! He'll be able to tell us Royd's entire life history!

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Hold. it. I don't think focusing on on Royd is the point... 47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Then you're the only one. Miranda looks back, seeing that the others all seem to be in agreement with him. They all look at D'Branin. D'Branin doesn't want to offend Royd, but he wants a muti even less. He turns to Eliza.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Give him the Esperon. Eliza looks at Jon on the table and then back at D'Branin in way that makes it clear that this is his responsibilit She removes the Psionine from the injection gun and takes vial of Esperon from her medical bag. CLOSE ON JON - He stares at the vial. JON'S POV: CLOSE ON THE VIAL ~ The ruby colored drug almo seems to glow with it's own light. Eliza loads the Esperon into the injection gun. As she brings it closer to Jon, he screams:

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Royd's holograph appears beside the table.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: There's no need for that. Release hin.

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: He HAS been watching us.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry this had to happen Royd. 48

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: I'll tell you my great secret, if my privacy intimidates you s0... Although your guesses were amusing, I'm afraid they were far from the mark. In truth, I am only... CLOSE ON VIDEO CAMERA - High up on the wall, the camera silently pans over to Owl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the master monitor, the image zooms in on Owl as he surreptitiously grabs the injection gun and pushes it against Jon's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royd's holograph moves right beside Owl. His voice roars into the bay:

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: NO! Stop. I order it! This is my ship. STOP! Owl presses the trigger, emptying the drug into Jon's bloodstream. There is a silence in the room as everyone waits for the drug to take effect. Eliza watches Jon closely as he slowly looks over at her, beginning to shiver.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I'm cold.... It's so cold...

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: It's the Esperon.... It'll stop ina minute. Let it help you... Tell us what you see. 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon stops shaking. His blue eyes cloud over.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Not close enough.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: ~Relax. It'll give you the range... Can you feel it? Everything is getting clearer now, isn't it? Jon's eyes clear. He laughs, in an oddly casual fashion a if amused by a revelation. CLOSE ON A HIDDEN VIDEO CAMERA - it zooms in for a closeu CLOSE ON JON - He stares at the camera, as if really seei the person behind it. Then a look of panic envelopes him. turns to Eliza and clutches her hand. She strokes his forehead. .

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: It*ll clear. Don't be afraid. Just tell us what you see. CLOSE ON JON ~ From his face, we dissolve to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the oval monitor, we see a fairly wide shot of Jon on operating table, with the holograph standing nearby. An adjacent monitor, shows a close up of the computer terminal, which controls the surgical/scanner. The image pans over to the cup which Owl had set down earlier. Sitting beneath the cup we can see the computer which controls the scanner/surgical machine. CLOSE ON THIS SMALLER SCREEN - Seemingly on it's own powe the cup begins to slide, towards the edge of the table. 50  om.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON JON - He looks over at the computer terminal, staring as if in a trance. HIS POV ~ The cup continues sliding, until it falls off t edge of the table... and onto the computer lying beneath As is does, the liquid causes a sparking to oecur in the computer. And the sparking ignites the alcohol.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Owl, what the hell's going on!? OWL . The computer's shorting out. Get the extinguisher! Darryl finds the extinguisher and brings it over to the computer, spraying it on the fire. It puts out the fire, creating a thick cloud of steam and smoke. But the sparki gets worse, and several lights on the operating table blo out, making it even darker. We hear a strange buzzing noise. Jon looks up, to his rig JON'S POV = The laser surgical arm jerks to life shooting thin crimson beam out into the dimly-lit bay.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: What the heli's going on? Shut the machine! She frantically tries to unclamp Jon's arm restraints, bu one of the robotic surgical hands jerks to life, smashing into her temple. She slumps to the floor. Owl rushes over to the computer terminal and finds it no longer has any effect on the machine. He reaches for the power switch. CLOSE ON THE SWITCH - As Owl's hand approaches it, the surgical arm whips around, cutting across his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl screams, pulling his hand away. He tries again and i burned even worse this time.

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: There's got to be some other way of shutting it off... Royd!

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: There is no remote response. You'll have to physically sever the machine from it's power source. Jon is still lying on the table, but no one can get near him. He looks at the holograph and suddenly yells out:

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: He's not controlling it at all! It's his... But his voice is cut off by a sickening, sizzling noise a the laser beam cuts through Jon's neck, decapitating him. Lilly screams, and the others react to the sight of Jon's headless torso on the operating table. On it's next arc, laser slices off Jon's left arm at the shoulder The screaming continues as the machine begins randomly performing portions of preprogrammed surgical operations: One of Jon's eyes are extracted. In another pass, a non- existent tumor is operated on. Interspersed with the precise surgical moves, the laser continues shooting erratically in all directions. Miranda runs away from the table and over to a work bench where s grabs a small, laser cutting torch. She switches it on. T torch produces a thin, sapphire-colored beam. Keeping low, she heads back to the surgical/scanner machi Inching as close as she dares, Miranda aims the torch at cable running from the machine to the ship's power outlet 52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns the torch's power up all the way and the thin b beam severs the cable in less than a second. The surgical/scanner machine suddenly goes dead. D'Branin and the others stare in horror at the carnage around then. Miranda comes over to where Eliza is lying on the floor, @ semi-conscious state. She kneels down by her and sees t a small piece of metal has snapped off from the surgical hand, and is imbedded into her temple.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Owl, help me get her into her cabin. Audrey, can the three of you wrap Jon in those sheets and get him into the pod bay? The three of them overcome their revuision, swiftiy doing they're told, following Miranda and Owl out of the bay. Finding himself alone, D'Branin calls out:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Royd... But there is no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zliza is heavily sedated, lying on her bed while Miranda removes the metal fragment from her forehead. . ANGLE ON MIRANDA - Working quickly, she applies a liquid suture to the wound, then covers Eliza with a blanket and leaves the roon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda enters, finding rest of the ‘team already there. §3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't understand what could've caused... what happened.

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: What there not to understand? Jon was about to reveal the truth about Royd, and he killed hin.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Actually, I think Royd was about to "reveal the truth", himself, when you gave Jon the injection. OwL Come off it. Look what he did to hin!

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: How could Royd have caused the machine to behave that way?

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: That's what we'd like to know!

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Sorry, but I don't believe it. And there doesn't seem to be any evidence to support Royd's guilt.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Did you see how fast his holograph disappeared when it happened?

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: This is all pure conjecture... The door to the lounge opens and a grim-looking D'Branin enters, carrying his a small flightbag. He sits beside Mi

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: (Continued) We can't condemn Royd until we hear his side of what happened. 54  He places his broken pieces

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: So where is he?

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: How is Eliza?

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: She's still in shock, but she'll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Viadimir, have you talked to Royd about what happened in there?

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: No... But I've done a little investigating and I believe this may answer a number of questions. briefcase on the table and takes out the ef Owl's cup which fell on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: What is is? Owl recognizes it immediately.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: It's a "coffee" cup, (he sniffs it) Although it's apparently used for more... volatile liquids. OWL . What are you saying? Are you saying I'm responsible for what happened in there?

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I'm saying we all just witnessed a terrible, accident. I don't believe anyone was necessarily at fault... 55  Owl stares at the pieces of the cup on the table which prevent him from arguing further. D'BRANIN (Continuing) My feeling is that Royd is as shocked as we are about what happened. He probably fears that we blame him. I hope we can reassure him this is not the case. He looks around to see if there are anymore protests or questions. There are none and he closes his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I assume we all have our final preparations to complete...

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: But we're returning to Avalon... aren't we? D'Branin stares at her incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Absolutely not! We're less than 8 hours from dropping out of drive and I see no reason to return. He rises and leaves the lounge. The dissenting members of the team look at one another, following him out in silenc Only Miranda remains. She pours herself a glass of brandy from the crystal decanter on the oval table and takes a s

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Captain... Did you hear? The glowing form of Royd's holograph is reflected in Miranda's glass, as it materializes behind her. She turns toward him.

dialogues.speaker: ROYS'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Yes. I hear and see... everything... on my Nightflyer, Miranda. But I assumed that you already knew that. 56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- -  - You're correct.

dialogues.speaker: ROYS'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Are you going to reassure me now? Miranda laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Isn't my very presence reassuring? She carries her glass over to the wali-sized video monito where she stands, looking out at space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is sitting in the couch. sipping her brandy. Royd holograph hovers close to her.

dialogues.speaker: ROYS'S HOLO
dialogues.text: I'm pleased that at least you and Dr. D’Branin do not think I murdered Jon. You were correct that I was about to reveal my secret when... the accident occurred. Miranda turns, looking directly up at the recessed video camera.

dialogues.speaker: . MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Who are you, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: . ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Your guesses were amusing, but sadly, the truth is less dramatic. IT am an ordinary man.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Then why all the secrecy? CLOSE ON THE HOLOGRAPH - The eyes gleam strangely as if t specter possessed a pride of nobility. 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother was a freetrader, a notably successful one. But she disliked people. When she grew rich enough, she had the Nightflyer built to her specifications; a ship that needed no crew.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: After thirty years of flying alone, Mother became bored. Actually, I should not call her my mother. I am her cross-sex clone. I was bred to be her companion and lover. ANGLE ON MIRANDA - She listens to Royd calmly without any visible reaction or judgement.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: I was placed in an embryonic tank but she died before my birth. She had programmed the ship for such an event, however. It drifted in interstellar space for eleven years while the ships's computer raised me.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: And this ship replicates the conditions of your birth, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Three moves ahead, as usual, Miranda. If mother taught me one thing, it is that my body has no natural immunities and that ecentact with any of you would probably kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Continued) The gravity the Nightfiyer is generating is for your comfort, not mine. To me it is agony... The floating chair that Iam sitting in supports my weight, but the painis still intense. So you see why I can't take on passengers too often.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Why take on people at all?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Unlike my mother, I enjoy company. I like to study the aliens I take on as riders.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Aliens?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S BOLO
dialogues.text: You are all aliens to me. There is a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: I understand... Royd, if I asked you to, would you agree not to watchor listen in on us... except in here? I think it would make a big difference to the others.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Even if I agreed, you'd still have no way of knowing. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE OVAL MONITOR - Miranda can be seen in the lounge, with the holograph standing near her. We see the the rest of the ship on the other monitors. 59

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e Except by trusting you. There is a brief silence.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: As you wish. I will henceforth restrict myself to this room. The silver-gloved hand picks up the lightpen. As it flash all the video screen go black, save for the oval monitor. Miranda turns away from the holograph so that she is look directly at us. The image zooms in so that her face fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey angrily storms into the bay with Lilly following close behind.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What a jerk! I wonder if we have grounds for aborting the mission or at least taking over...

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Taking over? Do think you might be overreacting?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: No! I don't! Surgical scanners's Just don't short-circuit like that. Somebody had to have been controlling it. She walks over to the main work table and Lilly follows.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Why don't you tell D'Branin that? 60  aa AUDREY @ Because he wouldn't believed me. She takes a length of cable and begins patching it from t team's computer into one of the ship's built-in terminals

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I'm linking our computer with the ship's.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: I can see that. Why? Audrey kneels down to the spot on the wali where she's go to patch in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e ITwant find out the truth about Royd. Do you want to help?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: I have a feeling Viadimir wouldn't - appreciate this.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: That's too bad. Do you want to help or not? Lilly watches Audrey for a moment, then she reluctantly reaches for a wire cutter and a cable connector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda sits, thinking about everything Royd has told her

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Se What really happened in there, Royd? What killed Jon? One of us? The Volcryn? 61  oy ae Royd is silent. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Are we in danger? Am I foolish not to be afraid?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: I like people. Particularly you and Dr. D'Branin. You have nothing to fear, I can protect you. x MIRANDA From what..?

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: What about the others, Royd? Will you protect them also?

dialogues.speaker: . ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: We've talked long enough. I have work to perform.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: I won't keep you. She finishes her brandy and rises from the couch.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: Miranda...

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: I... admire you more than anyone I've ever met... Miranda's laugh is rich and deep.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: That's quite @ compliment. 62  She moves slowly towards the holograph glowing in the air before her. .

dialogues.speaker: ROYD'S HOLO
dialogues.text: I asked you not to... But Miranda stops before passing through it. She holds ou her hand. Royd's slowly rises to meet hers. Ever-so- delicately her toned, muscular flesh touches his pale radiance. As Miranda looks into the holograph's eyes, it suddenly disappears. She stands there a moment and then leaves the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey is sitting at the Nightfiyer's terminal while Lill checks the place they've patched in with her multimeter.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Maybe we could even take over the ship's flight controls. Audrey types in a command and Lilly comes over, sitting beside her. LILLY. Theoretically possible, but I doubt it... Let's see if we can get in first... Audrey types in another command and the screen filis up w data,

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Look at this... Lilly studies the code on the screen. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the data on the hardware. Forget about taking over. The Nightflyer's system is about ten times more powerful than ours... Audrey types another command.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: This is interesting... the life support specs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmmm. It looks like Royd isn't an artificial intelligence system after all. Audrey types in another command.

dialogues.speaker: , AUDREY
dialogues.text: Nothing unusual here. Any other ideas?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: You could check for nutrient tanks, cloning equipment, that sort of thing. Find Royd's life history~- the trading records, if there are any.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: That's it! The ship's log. There must be one. As she types in a new command an alarm goes off.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Shit! Then an ominous bass rumbling is heard behind them. They turn to see a huge, grey, steel panel slides across the access to the corridor. 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the..?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: The backup airseal. They look at each other resliting the implications.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Quick! She grabs Lilly and they run towards the door, as they do a hideous, whistling sound can be heard, from the directi of the outer airlock.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Come on! They sprint towards the inner door. The whistling noise i deafening and the vacuum is already pulling at things tha aren't bolted down. Lilly is struck by a flying cardboard box and she trips. Audrey is considerably faster than she is, and doesn't notice that Lilly is down until she's at the outer lock. Audrey starts back in to help her, but as she does, Lilly sucked up off the floor, and across the bay, smashing with bone breaking force, against the doors cf the outer airlock. She hangs there a moment untii the doors open wi enough for her to be sucked out into space. The roaring and whistling noise drowns out her own scream as Audrey feels her feet being pulled out from under her. She grabs on to a chair, which is boited to the floor, an pulls her way, over it, then over a desk, managing to get enough forward momentum to push herself back toward the still-closing, grey-steel door of the backup airlock. She slips through the crack at the last possible second befor it clangs loudly into place. 65

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
