dialogues.text: The sound of an explosion is heard and alarms go off alli ever the ship. The ship lurches so violently Miranda is thrown out of her bunk to the ground. Then just as sudden everything is still. Miranda gets up and presses the communicator on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Royd, what's happening?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm still trying to find out. Miranda tries to rouse Zliza. She opens her eyes slowly, looking very stoned. Miranda gets a safety strap and secu her tightly in her bunk, then leaves the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda walks down the corridor, picking up the other Members of the team as they emerge from their respective quarters. They gather in the corridor like refugees from some natur disaster. D'Branin turns to Miranda:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: What happened? Miranda hits the call button on the communicator mounted the wall. Royd's voice rings out through the corridor,

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Royd, we're missing two of our team.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that since I've deactivated all my monitors save for the one in the lounge ~ at Miranda's request, ~ I have no way of knowing for certain where they are. 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reactivate them, goddammit! There is a brief pause.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cargo hold #2 is badly damaged. It was breached while we were under drive. The Nightflyer's computer automatically dropped us out of drive otherwise we would've been completely torn apart by the flux. Darryl and Audrey exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: How did it happen, Captain? As Royd answers, Audrey walks into view, looking as if sh in a state of shock. She and sits down in a corner, tucki herself into a near-fetal position.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The flight log records that your colleagues had issued a command which erroneously opened the held's loading dock. They seem to have been using the system to gain access to the Nightflyer's flight controls. D'Branin turns to Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Is that true? Audrey's silence answers the question.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Where's Lilly? Audrey remains silent and D'Branin screams at her:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I'm asking you a question! 67  Audrey breaks down, sebbing uncontrollably and unable to speak. Miranda comes over and puts an arm around her. D'Branin looks at her as if not knowing how to relate to her. He speaks into the communicator:

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Royd, do you have any information about Lilly?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It appears she is no longer on board the ship. We can only assume that she is dead.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm hopeful that the damage to the ship is not irreparable. CLOSE ON D'BRANIN - The shock of what just happened begin to set in on him. He just sits there in a daze. Miranda replies for him.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Captain, we'll leave you to assess the damage and we'll continue this discussion in the morning. She switches off the communicator. Owl turns to her. own You believe him, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I do know that the other cargo hold can be opened the same way number two was. I'm moving my sleep web in to Eliza's cabin, and I suggest that the rest ef you should move into the lounge. 68  - ll --  DARRYL e I think we should take our suits out of the pod bay and keep them nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Good idea. Royd can't blame us for taking precautions.

dialogues.speaker: / OWL
dialogues.text: BLAME US!!? For Christ's sake,

dialogues.speaker: ROYD ERRIS IS KILLING US
dialogues.text: Looking at Owl, Miranda sees no point in arguing. D'Brani mutters to himself.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: We've lost the computer...

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Perhaps we can make do with the portables. D'Branin nods distractedly.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I'm not about to lose them. Not after... He looks around the room at everyone in an odd way, as if noticing them for the first time. Then he rises and walks down the corrider toward his cabin. Own Them?

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: The Voleryn, obviously! You don't think he cares about losing us do you?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: @ That's not true.  ~_-—% The others turn to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: If we were all dead, he wouldn't have anyone to help him document his precious creatures. Believe me, that would upset him.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: He's as upset as the rest of us. Maybe more so...

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Under the circumstances I think it would be best to leave our captain alone. Both accident occurred when People were trying to uncover Royd's secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't think that's just a teensy bit suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Enough that I don't intend to be the next one to give it a crack... I'm going to get some sleep. I suggest the rest of you do the same. She leaves the lounge. Darryl looks over at the communica on the wall and then whispers to Owl:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he can hear us? Owl looks at him as if he's a fool to even ask.

dialogues.speaker: OWL
dialogues.text: Let's get our suits. 70 He comes over and helps Audrey up. The three of them wal down the corridor. We move in close to the glowing red li on the communicator and DISSOLVE To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UN ANOTHER RED COMMUNICATOR LIGHT - We move back to reveal D'Branin working at his desk as the light of false day comes up slowly in the cabin. The door opens and as Miranda enters, nearly loses her balance as the ship roli on its axis. She presses the communicator on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Royd?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes, Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: How bad is it? RoYD (0.S.) Hold three is completely ruined. We're extremely fortunate, however, as the drive system still seem to be intact... I'm worried about our return trip. I don't know if the airseal can stand the stress of going back into drive. It could tear the ship in half.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Is there anything we can do?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I can reinforce the exposed areas with some of the hull that was torn loose. It's still floating within a Kilometer of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: We have four pods of our own... We could retrieve the pieces. 71  “yy

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: I'll have to do the actual repairs. myself. But that's not my primary concern.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: You? But what about your muscles, your weakness... can't we help you?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm only crippled in gravity. Weightless, I'm in my own element and I plan to kill the gravity grid shortly. If I emerge from my chambers do you think you can keep the others from killing me?

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Royd, we're not criminals. How can you think that we'd try and harm you?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: You know they're suspicious of me. Don't give me false assurances.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: You would be in danger, but I think that by showing yourself you'd set them at ease. At least they could see that you told them the truth.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They think I killed their friends. They're frightened.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I don't see how we can give you any guarantees.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: I might have prevented the accident... But you made me turn off my monitors,. Miranda. 72  Miranda and D'Branin exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How can you protect me if I come out?

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I can send the others off to retrieve the hull fragments, and Miranda can stay with you. We'll get it done three times as fast.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: As you will. I'm going to depower the gravity grid. Prepare your crew.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: One of our team is injured. I think she should remain on board to... Royd's voice blasts through the com system:

dialogues.speaker: BOARD
dialogues.text: The monitor crackles and then shuts off. D'Branin and Miranda look at each other then leave the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MIRANDA ~ dressed in her space~suit, she is wait in her pod. Behind her, the rest of the crew are gatherin hull fragments: D'Branin, with Eliza on his pod, Audrey a Darryl on a second pod. Owl is off separate from them on third. MIRANDA'S POV - The Nightflyer floats languidly amid the alien starscape. The smaller sphere which comprises hold is shattered, but a major section portion of metal dangle from it, giving it an unbalanced look. 73 A circular airlock in the front of the ship, dilates, an Royd flies out. His pod is larger and of an odd design. ANGLE ON MIRANDA - We can see the anticipation in her eye as Royd approaches. ANGLE ON ROYD - He glides closer to Miranda. As his pod emerges from a shadow , we can see his face... the same, somehow younger than his holograph. He looks frightened. Royd and Miranda look at each other for a moment in silen

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: We have a good deal of work to do, Miranda.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: First, let's talk. She maneuvers her pod close enough to his, so that they a touching. :

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Turn off your comm. The sound will carry through the glass. They both do so.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: It's okay, now...

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: I don't like this Miranda. It's too obvious. This is dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: There's no other way. Royd, I know what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Always three moves ahead. I knew you would. 74  ay

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Your ship is killing us Captain. Not you. Please explain it to me.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: No. You're safer if you remain ignorant. Just do as I tell you! All of you zze in danger, but I can protect you... if you let me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl is hiding behind a large section of shattered huli. Watching Miranda and Royd, he looks convinced of their complicity. Bringing his pod around in a wide circle, he vanishes behind the ship.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: You understand too much already. All you. need to know is that the ship is malfunctioning. You'll have to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Trust is a two way bond.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Enough! We have repairs to make. Let's see just how improved you really are. With that, he backs his pod up and moves towards the ship

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow] brings his pod alongside the ship, and manually opens the airlock to the pod bay. He braces himself for what he knows is within. 15  or HIS POV ~ As the lock dilates, a shaft of light illuminat the body of the headless telepath, still draped in the bloody sheets. CLOSE ON THE HEADLESS TELEPATH - It floats like a grisly guardian, tethered loosely to a suppert beam by the door the inner lock. Somehow, it looks natural, as if it never had a head at all. CLOSE ON OWL - He looks away, but as if against his will, his eyes keep returning to the corpse. The lock slides al the way open and Owl rides his pod inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl watches as the lock wedges back into place. As the chamber repressurizes, the hissing air jets cause the telepath's corpse te sway gently back and forth. When the ready light comes on, Owl twists opens the inner lock and moves into the ship's main corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl slips his helmet off and glances around. Unused to th weightless, he moves clumsily through the corridor and enters the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl pushes himself across the room, floating above the furniture. He bangs into a chair, and bounds over the conference table to the rear of the lounge. Reaching the bulkhead separating the lounge from Royd's cabin, Owl removes a small, laser torch from his back pack. He switches it on, and aims the thin blue beam at t bulkhead. High up on the wall behind him, a video camera pans in hi direction. 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl's image fills the central monitor. The image zooms in on Owl's hand until the laser torch fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owl smiles as the laser beam begins to cut through the metal. Behind him the door to the lounge slides silently open. Owl pauses, sensing the movement in his peripheral vision. Something cold and wet touches his face. He spins around sees nothing. A moment later it happens again, and this t he sees it. OWL'S POV - A cloudy blue eye which was surgically remove from Jon the telepath, is floating in the air directly in front of Owl's face. Owl stares at it in revulsion then grabs it, throwing it across the room. Shuddering. he switches the laser back o He is about to resume cutting when an arm grabs him aroun his neck and jerks him away from the wail. The laser flies out of Owl's hand. Owl whirls round to se it grabbed by the headless corpse. It raises the laser an turns it slowly toward owl. ANGLE ON OWL - He screams in mortal terror. We move up to a video camera on the opposite wall, aimed down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working with Miranda, Royd uses his pod's cybernetic arms to weld a section of armor plating back onto the damaged hull. He checks the weld. 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done. Just then they hear horrible, tortured cries in their headsets.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: What the hell's that? Royd's eyes go up to the ship's top sphere from which he emerged earlier.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl and Audrey are on the other side of the ship in th pod, towing some fragments of the hull, when they hear th cries. ‘

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: It's Owl. Where the hell is he? They look around and see that he's no longer with the others. Audrey grabs his arm and points to where Owl's po is parked outside the airlock. ANGLE ON ROYD AND MIRANDA - We can hear Audrey over the c systen.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He went back in the ship. Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Right... 78  oy ANGLE ON AUDREY - She ejects the scraps of metal from off pod and activates the rockets, shooting them back towards the Nightfiyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'Branin is coming back towards the snip, towing a net fi with hull fragments. Eliza, still heavily sedated, sits peacefully beside hin. HIS POV; Miranda and Royd are rising up out from the dama hold towards where Audrey and Darryl are waiting for the lock to open.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Miranda! Where's Owl!? We can see Miranda turning back to him. ; MIRANDA (in headset) He went back in... The voices overlap the screams from within the ship. D'BRANIN'S POV - We see Royd and Miranda flying back in a futile effort to intercept Darryl and Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I beg you to listen! If your colleague is in the ship alone, he is dead. AUDREY {(0.S.) . How do you know? Did you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: NO! But I could've protected him from the same fate. Please stop!

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Audrey, we have no way of knowing what's happening in there... Don't go in! 79

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puck off, Miranda!

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: If you want to help, Miranda, keep Royd away from his goddam controls until we can get Owl!

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Dr. D’Branin, they don't know what they're doing. Please help me! CLOSE ON D'BRANIN ~ He screams to them:

dialogues.speaker: THAT'S AN ORDER.
dialogues.text: HIS POV - The airlock open wide enough for them to enter Darryl and Audrey fly through. It closes again by the tim Roya and Miranda reach them.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Royd, if you go in through your lock and head for your cabin. I']1l try to stop them. We see Royd trying to activate some controls in his pod. They seem to have no effect on the lock.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: It's toa late. The ship will not respond to my controls.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Because I'm being kept outside until... until mother is done with then. 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl and Audrey are bounding down the hall towards the ljounge where the cries seem to be emanating. Darryl flip back his helmet and puts his ear to the door. The screams sound louder now.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: God! It's awful! He's in there... He reaches out to press the panel which opens the lounge door and Audrey grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Wait aminute! We might needa weapon. How do we know there isn't something in there with him?

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: There's one way to find out. He slams the panel and bursts into the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save for the light coming in from the corridor, the loung is dark and apparently empty. Audrey hesitates, watching from the doorway. Darryl whispers:

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Owl... where are you? He moves across the room, towards the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl Flips on the light finding himself in a room with bright red globules of blood floating all over the Place. He waves his hand through an especially large glob and it disperses into hundreds of smaller bubbles. ei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming. He carefully avoids the cabinet containing the food processor and open a drawer containing the kitchen implements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey hesitantly enters the room, inching her way along the wall. She passes the communicator and stops suddenly, realizing that Owl's cries are coming from the speaker grill.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: No... Audrey senses some movement behind her, and turns to see the corpses of the headless telepath standing in front of the wall-sized video screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl has just removed a large steak knife from a drawer when we hear Audrey scream :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The headless telepath slowly approaches Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL...
dialogues.text: She bolts out of the lounge just as Darryl emerges from t kitchen holding a large steak knife. He freezes, seeing t corpse moving towards him. 82  —o~,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey frantically bounds down the hall, crashing into th walls in her panicked effort to escape. At the end of the corridor, she pounds on the panel for the air lock. It op and she dives through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the panel slides closed after her, she leans against i panting for breath. Then, feeling guilty about having abandoned Darryl, she pounds on the panel and it shoots o She peeks out, looking down the corridor. HER POV: The corridor is empty and utterly still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darryl! Darryl... After a pause, Darryi's voice comes through a speaker in corridor.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL, (0.5.)
dialogues.text: Boy, talk about bravery in the face of death... Audrey winces with guilt, but at the same time is relieve

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Hey, I told you to get out of there! Darryl... where are you?

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: I'm cleaning up after myseif, unlike some people. Audrey hesitantly steps into corridor and walks back down towards the lounge. 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda and Royd have been joined by D'Branin and Eliza's outside the damaged hold.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Royd, you told us your mother died ~- before you were boii. Within the pod's shield, Royd's expression is anguished.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: I have never lied to you.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: But you haven't told us the whole story!

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Royd, we've trusted you. You must tell us why this is all happening! Eliza moans as she breaks through her sedation.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: It's her... ghost that's been killing us. Royd and Miranda look at one another and then at Royd. He doesn't deny the explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lounge is dark, save for a slash of light coming from the galley. The door to the lounge slides open and Audrey cautiously peers in whispering:

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Darryl... There is no response. 84  ey As Audrey starts backing away from the door, we hear Darryl's voice coming from the lounge. He sounds hurt.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dammit... Give me a hand, will you? Audrey starts into the room then hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: How do I know it's you? There is a brief silence. Then we hear groaning noises.

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL
dialogues.text: Fine! Just let me bleed to death! Just get the hell out! Torn by guilt and anxiety, Audrey steps into the room, an haltingly approaches the galiey.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I'm sorry! The door to the galley suddenly opens and we see Darryl i laid out on the counter, obviously dead. The headless telepath is standing before it. It's one hand gripped aro the handle of the steak knife, which is imbedded in Darry chest. Darryl's voice comes over the com system softly whispering:

dialogues.speaker: DARRYL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Too late... Audrey screams and bounds cut of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hysterical and running for her life now, (as best as one in weightlessness,) Audrey head for the pod bay through which she and Darryl entered the ship. 65 As she turns the corner, her helmet falls off the back h Suit, but Audrey doesn't notice. She keeps on running unt she reaches the Pod Bay, where she pounds on the illumina Panel on the wall. The inner lock slowly opens and she ru through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey presses the panel to open the outer lock when she realizes her helmet is gone. She looks back towards the inner lock, but decides instead to head directly for her pod. She bounds over to it and is about to get in, when w hear the sound of the inner lock cycling open. Audrey quickly ducks into the pod and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey holds her breath as the torso walks past the pod a out of sight. After a pause, we hear the inner lock cycli open again. Remaining hidden, Audrey reaches up to start pod's rocket, but as she does, the the door to pod is jer open. She is violently pulled out by the telepath's remaining arm,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one smooth motion, the headless telepath smashes Audre against the wall to the pod bay, breaking her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE OVAL MONITOR - We see the headless telepath, opening the pod bay's outer airlock. It tosses Audrey's torso out into space, away from where the others could se at. As the lock slowly closes, the image changes to a point o view outside the Nightflyer where we see the pods of Royd Miranda, D'Branin and Eliza still hovering near the other side of the ship. 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royd is continuing with his explanation.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: My mother's spirit... or whatever you chose to call it, resides in the ship's computer. It has an organic, erystal matrix core.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Esperstone? ~ He nods, somberly.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Before my mother died, she transferred her consciousness into this core. She had shown signs of instability in the past, but I see now, that she's become truly mad.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: How is she doing it? I can understand how she can open and close an airlock, but what about Jon?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: In life, mother had tremendous Powers of telekenesis. They have only become stronger...

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: And under weightlessness, her power would he...

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Enormous. Yes. Gravity is her one great limitation. They turn to the epen lock of the drive room. 87  rONN

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: They are all probably dead. And knowing mother as Ido, I must tell you that she could never allow you to return to Avaion alive. Miranda and D'Branin look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: What about you, Royd? Aren't you in any danger?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: If she believed I had deserted her - that I had chosen to side with you, then she would kill me too. I would have to prove my allegiance. I could kill you both, right now and win my way back into Mother's good graces. He touches his pod's laser cannon. There is a long silenc as he looks into Miranda's eyes and then. atD'Branin.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: You could try, Captain... But I caution you, the improved model is not easy to kill. CLOSE ON ROYD - He glances at the Nightflyer and then bac at Miranda. The decision is a painful one for him. Finall he take his hand from the pod's laser cannon.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: I would not kill you. I've lived for 39 years and I have never lived at all. If we lose, we ali die together. If we win, well, I shall die anyway...

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Your mother lied to you, Royd! You won't die without the ship! 86  ~ om, RoyYD No matter. Death does not frighten - me. .

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Is there any way to get back in? Royd looks back at the ship.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Through the drive room. A low moan is heard over the headsets. It takes a moment the three of them to realize that it's coming from Eliza. She begins struggling to free herself from her bonds. D'B and Miranda kneel down to aid her. Beneath the faceplate, Eliza's eyes flick rapidly back an forth between Royd, Miranda and D'Branin.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Can you hear us? Are you allright?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZA
dialogues.text: The Volcryn...

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: Where? She looks out into space and following her gaze, we see a faint, colored glow of light in the distance. This revelation is interrupted by an ominous, low-pitched RUSHING noise coming from the Nightfiyer. The three others look back at the ship to see another glowing light in the direction of the Nightflyer; the glo of of the fusion rings behind the drives.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Hurry! The ship is preparing to move! 89  He and Miranda start up the rockets on their pods, but D'Branin hesitates, torn between kis dream, and his allegiance to what's left of his team. Miranda turns to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking. Go to to then. D'Branin's expression answers her question.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Don't worry about us.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Dr. D'Branin, you do understand that my mother is about to move the ship. If we're unable to stop her, you'll be left behind.

dialogues.speaker: D'BRANIN
dialogues.text: I realizes that.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Eliza, come with us! Eliza shakes her head. She continues to stare out into sp toward the colored glow, Miranda and D'Branin's eyes lock for a final time.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: We have no time left. He pulls the throttle back on his pod and heads for the open lock which leads into the drive room. Miranda starts her pod and passes him, entering the ship first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda's pod is leading the way down the long barrel of the chamber when Royd pulls abreast of her, stiff and menacing in his black, bulky armor. Side by side they sai past the glowing, cylindrical stardrives. 90

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we reach the inner lock, jump on to my pod The two pods slow as they approach the inner wall of the driveroom. Miranda abandons her pod jumping on behind Roy while he reaches out to cycle open the lock. As the door open, they glide through into the lock chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royd turns back to Miranda as they proceed:

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Once the lock opens... it will begin. Most of the ship's furnishing are either built in or bolted into piace but the things your crew brought on board are not. Mother will use then... Royd lowers the pod. The grapplers make a metallic sound they touch the chamber floor. The inner door opens and Royd applies the thrusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first section of the corridor is empty and quiet. As they reach the point where it curves off sharply, they notice a long tube of some sort, suspended in the air bef them. Royd's hands tighten on the laser weapon as they approach

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: What is..? As the pod round the bend, the tube turns out to be a par ef Darryl's lower intestinal tract. 91 Cut open from crotch to throat, he is suspended in midai his guts, which have been stretched out from floor to ceiling in a grotesque parody of a spiders web.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Oh, God...

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: Forgive my lack of reverence, but knowing mother as I do... He raises the grapplers and applies the thrusters and bui up speed, ramming the pod through the center of the web. They burst through, spreading a fine mist of blood into t air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE OVAL MONITOR ~- Royd's pod is flying down th corridor which leads up to the lounge. We hear Royd yelis Miranda:

dialogues.speaker: HOLD ON
dialogues.text: The pod crashes inte the door. The impact shatters it lik cardboard and carries them through into the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pod scrapes along the floor slamming into the confere table. Miranda is thrown to the floor. Before she can get her feet, the headless telepath is upon her, wielding the large steak knife. Royd fires his laser and slices the corpse into a number smaller pieces. The arm holding the knife continues after Miranda. 92 Royd continues firing, slicing the hand from the arm, th fingers from the hand until the knife is left to carry on its work by itseif. It slashes wildly at Miranda and stab deeply into her shoulder, slicing through her suit.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Damn! She reaches out and grabs the knife. Examining the cut wi her other hand, she sees that the wound has drawn blood. stares at the wound and mentally stems the flow of.blood. Miranda looks up to see Owl's laser torch flying through the air towards Royd,

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: ROYD! BEHIND You! Royd turns, and the thin blue beam from the torch hits him squarely in the chest. Royd returns fire, and the pod heavy-duty laser hits the pistol, melting it.

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA
dialogues.text: Are you wounded?

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: No. My suit is better armored than yours and her laser was a low- powered toy. Royd activates the thrusters and moves the pod to where O had begun to cut into the bulkhead earlier. He switches o the pod's laser.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: We'll be through in five minutes or less. Miranda notices some movement in her peripheral vision an turns to see a large, ornate mirror coming off the opposi wall and flying through the air towards them. Miranda quickly picks up a chair, smashing the mirror in midair. 93  Almost simultaneously, the light fixture above the oval table begins swinging around, faster and faster until it breaks free and flies through the room towards them. Mira gives it the same treatment as the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ROYD
dialogues.text: De you need help?

dialogues.speaker: MIRANDA

Simultaneously, there is a violent explosion from within kitchen and the paneling bursts open, lashing utensils, glasses, plates, knives, pieces of flesh and bones across the room towards Royd at ballistic speeds. Then time seems to slow as he steps off the sled and knee crawling through the opening. Miranda sees that the remains of the corpse are gliding towards her once again. The utensils rise up off the grou and begin flying at Miranda when the whole ship suddenly lurches violently. Miranda closes her eyes and concentrates on the inner airlock.
